oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Artist in Residence - Earl Scruggs - 2004-09-29 - set one
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Fourth of four Artist in Residence performances by Earl Scruggs from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 29, 2004. Set one of two. Special guests include: Gary Scruggs, Glen Duncan, Eddie Bayers, Rob Ickes, John Jorgenson, Bryan Sutton, Jon Randall Stewart.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Earl Scruggs; Gary Scruggs; Glen Duncan; Eddie Bayers; Rob Ickes; John Jorgenson; Bryan Sutton; Jon Randall Stewart;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress. Opening comments and introductions by Kyle Young. Performances include: Salty Dog Blues (Gary Scruggs - vocal) -- Borrowed Love (Unidentified vocalists likely Jon Randall - vocal) -- band introductions -- Earl's Breakdown - Earl Scruggs - banjo) -- Ashes Of Love (John Jorgenson - vocal) -- In The Pines (Unidentified vocalist likely John Jorgenson - vocal) -- You Ain't Going Nowhere (Gary Scruggs - vocals) -- Doin' My Time (Gary Scruggs - vocal) -- Someday We'll Meet Again Sweetheart (Jon Randall - vocal) -- Foggy Mountain Rock (Rob Ickes - dobro) -- John Hardy Was A Desperate Little Man (Bryan Sutton - vocal) -- Soldier's Joy (Earl Scruggs - banjo) -- Intermission -- Short break -- Introduction of E. W. Wendell -- Comments and presentations from E. W. Wendell -- Kyle Young Introduces video clips -- End Of Recording.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Scruggs, Earl; Scruggs, Gary; Duncan, Glen; Ickes, Rob; Bayers, Eddie; Stewart, Jon Randall; Jorgenson, John; Sutton, Bryan; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
